Package pbxuniverse

Class ExpanderVerse

java.lang.Object
pbxuniverse.ExpanderVerse
public class ExpanderVerse
extends Object
Control addressable LED displays from your computer. Requires a compatible USB to Serial adapter, and one or more the Pixelblaze Output Expander boards.

To build a display:

  • create an ExpanderVerse object
  • open your serial ports with OpenPort

  • use AddOutputExpander(PBXSerial) to add output expanders to the serial ports
  • use the appropriate AddChannel(PBXBoard) variant to add output channels.

    Pixel order is determined by the order in which you add Output Expander boards and channels. As you create channels, ExpanderVerse maintains a default 1D (x,0,0) mapping so for 1D strip setups, you can use the map for rendering without any further work. If you have a more complex layout, you can set a custom (x,y,z) mapping after all channels have been added.

    To draw to your LEDs:

  • use the SetPixel(i,color) or pixels[i].setColor(color) functions to set your LEDs
  • call Expanderverse.draw() to render all the pixels when set.

      • getPort

        public PBXSerial getPort​(String portName)
        Given the name of a serial port ("COM5", "/dev/ttyUSBsomething"), returns the port object associated with that name if it exists. The port names should match exactly, except for case, which is ignored. Return null if the specified port is not found.
        Parameters:
        portName -
        Returns:
        Serial port object

      • getPortList

        public LinkedList<PBXSerial> getPortList()
        Gets the list of open serial port objects. The list may be empty.
        Returns:
        port list

      • getPort

        public PBXSerial getPort​(int n)
        Given the "index" of an open serial port returns the associated port object. ExpanderVerse stores open ports in the order they are opened, so the first port opened will be at index 0, the second at index 1, and so on.

        Returns null if the specified port is not found.

        Parameters:
        portName -
        Returns:
        Serial port object

      • addOutputExpander

        public PBXBoard addOutputExpander​(PBXSerial port, int boardNo)
        Create a new board, attach it to the specified port and return the object. Board number is the hardwired board id on the bus. Setting a board to an ID other than zero requires physically cutting a trace on the board.
        Parameters:
        port - - open port object
        boardNo - - id of the board, 0-7
        Returns:
        new board object

      • addOutputExpander

        public PBXBoard addOutputExpander​(PBXSerial port)
        Create a new board, attach it to the specified port as board 0 and return the object. Setting a board to an ID other than zero requires physically cutting a trace on the board. See Pixelblaze website (www.electromage.com) for more information
        Parameters:
        port - - open port object
        Returns:
        new board object

      • addChannelWS2812

        public PBXDataChannel addChannelWS2812​(PBXBoard board, int chNumber, int pixelCount, String colorString)
        Create channel for RGB or RGBW WS2812/Neopixel class LEDs
        Parameters:
        board - previously created board object
        chNumber - channel number (on board) to create
        pixelCount - number of pixels attached to this channel
        colorString - string describing color order, e.g "RGB", "GRBW"
        Returns:
        channel object

      • addChannelAPA102

        public PBXDataChannel addChannelAPA102​(PBXBoard board, int chNumber, int pixelCount, int frequency, String colorString)
        Create data channel for APA102/Dotstar LEDs
        Parameters:
        board - previously created board object
        chNumber - channel number (on board) to create
        pixelCount - number of pixels attached to this channel
        frequency - desired output clock frequency (in hz) for this channel, e.g 2000000, 800000
        colorString - string describing color order, e.g "RGB", "GRBW"
        Returns:
        channel object

      • addChannelAPAClock

        public PBXDataChannel addChannelAPAClock​(PBXBoard board, int chNumber, int frequency)
        Create clock channel for APA102/Dotstar LEDs

        If you use APA102s, you will need to dedicate one channel on the output expander to the APA clock signal.

        Parameters:
        board - previously created board object
        chNumber - channel number (on board) to create
        frequency - desired output clock frequency (in hz) for this channel, e.g 2000000, 800000
        Returns:
        channel object

      • addChannel

        public PBXDataChannel addChannel​(PBXBoard board, ChannelType type, int chNumber, int pixelCount, int frequency, String colorString)
        Helper function for channel creation: Creates a new channel of specified type and adds it to a board
        Parameters:
        board - previously created board object
        type - channel type/protocol - WS2812, APA102, or APACLOCK
        chNumber - channel number (on board) to create
        pixelCount - number of pixels attached to this channel
        frequency - desired output clock frequency (in hz) for this channel, e.g 2000000, 800000
        colorString - string describing color order, e.g "RGB", "GRBW"
        Returns:
        channel object

      • addChannel

        public PBXDataChannel addChannel​(PBXBoard board, ChannelType type, int chNumber, int pixelCount, String colorString)
        Helper function for channel creation. Creates a new channel of specified type and adds it to a board. (If an APA102 or APACLOCK channel is created using this method, it's clock frequency will default to 2000000bps.
        Parameters:
        board - previously created board object
        type - channel type/protocol - WS2812, APA102, or APACLOCK
        chNumber - channel number (on board) to create
        pixelCount - number of pixels attached to this channel
        colorString - string describing color order, e.g "RGB", "GRBW"
        Returns:
        channel object

      • addChannel

        public PBXDataChannel addChannel​(PBXBoard board, ChannelType type, int chNumber, int Frequency)
        Helper function for channel creation: Creates a new channel of specified type and adds it to a board. This prototype, which doesn't include pixelCount, is aimed at creating APA102 clock channels.
        Parameters:
        board - previously created board object
        type - channel type/protocol - WS2812, APA102, or APACLOCK
        chNumber - channel number (on board) to create
        Frequency - - clock frequency
        Returns:
        channel object

      • addChannel

        public PBXDataChannel addChannel​(PBXBoard board, ChannelType type, int chNumber)
        Helper function for channel creation. Creates a new channel of specified type and adds it to a board. This 'helper' prototype is aimed at quick creation of APA102 Clock channels. Frequency will default to 2000000 bits/sec.
        Parameters:
        board - previously created board object
        type - channel type/protocol - WS2812, APA102, or APACLOCK
        chNumber - channel number (on board) to create
        Returns:
        channel object

      • setGlobalBrightness

        public void setGlobalBrightness​(float b)
        Sets brightness for all ports, boards and channels. Settings made at the global level will overwrite previous settings for individual ports boards and channels.
        Parameters:
        b - global brightness level (0..1)

      • getGlobalBrightness

        public float getGlobalBrightness()
        Get the current global brightness setting (0..1)

      • setGammaCorrection

        public void setGammaCorrection​(float g)
        Sets gamma correction factor (power curve exponenent) for all ports, boards and channels. Settings made at the global level will overwrite previous settings for individual ports boards and channels.
        Parameters:
        b - global gamma factor (0..1)

      • setColorCorrection

        public void setColorCorrection​(float r, float g, float b)
        Sets r,g and b color correction factors - values in the range 0..1 that will be multiplied with pixel colors to produce the particular 'white' you want to match. Settings made at the global level will overwrite previous settings for individual ports boards and channels.

      • setDrawMode

        public void setDrawMode​(DrawMode dm)
        Sets pixel drawing mode, either DrawMode.FAST (brightness & gamma adjustment only) or DrawMode.ENHANCED (brightness, gamma, color correction, color depth expansion if supported by LEDs). DrawMode can be changed at any time. Settings made at this level will override previous settings for all ports, boards and channels.

      • setPixel

        public void setPixel​(int index, int c)
        Sets the pixel at the specified index to a color.

        Note: The color parameter 'c' is shown as an int here. It's actually a processing color() type, which is really just an int encoded by Processing's internal preprocessor. This convenience is not available to Java libraries. From Processing though, you can call it like this:

        setPixel(0,color(r,g,b))

        or, depending on your colorMode()

        setPixel(0,color(h,s,v))

        and the right thing will happen.

      • setAllPixels

        public void setAllPixels​(int color)
        Sets all pixels associated with this ExpanderVerse object to a single color.
        Parameters:
        color -

      • clearPixels

        public void clearPixels()
        Sets all pixels associated with this ExpanderVerse object to black (off)

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Render all pixels to the LEDs on all ports, adapters and channels.

      • setImageIndex

        public void setImageIndex​(int pix, int imageIndex)
        The image index tells which pixel in a PImage of appropriate size corresponds to this LED
        Parameters:
        pix - index of the LED in ExpanderVerse's pixel list.
        imageIndex - the index in a PImage's pixel array that this pixel should use when transferring

      • setMapCoordinates

        public void setMapCoordinates​(int i, PVector m)
        Sets 3D world coordinates for the specified pixel
        Parameters:
        i - index of LED
        m - 3D vector of world coordinates. If you're not using a coordinate dimension, it should be set to 0.

      • setNormalizedCoordinates

        public void setNormalizedCoordinates​(int i, PVector m)

      • normalizeMapSegment

        public void normalizeMapSegment​(int start, int count)

      • buildNormalizedMap

        public void buildNormalizedMap()
        Build a normalized map from the world coordinate map. World coordinate map must be set before calling this method or mayhem will ensue.

      • setPixelsFromImage

        public void setPixelsFromImage​(int index, int count, int[] image)
        Index map must be set before calling this (as by setMatrixMap), or the displayed result will not be predictable.

        Will throw an exception if the specified image does not contain enough pixels to fill the request, or if one of the index map coordinates is out of bounds.

        Parameters:
        index - of starting pixel in display
        count - number of pixels to set
        image - array of image pixels

      • setMatrixMap

        public void setMatrixMap​(int index, int xSize, int ySize, boolean zigzag)
        Builds an index map for a section of the display beginning with pixel 'pix', that orders the pixels as though they were a wired 2D matrix, with either zigzag or linear wiring. a section of the overall display into zigzag-wired 2D matrix. This map allows for simple, rapid copying of pixels from a rectangular portion of any Processing PImage into the LED buffer without having to worry about coordinate translation. TODO - no parameter validation. Will throw an exception if there aren't enough pixels TODO - allow setting Z coordinate to a single plane (other than 0)
        Parameters:
        index - - index of starting pixel
        xSize - - x dimension of matrix
        ySize - - y dimension of matrix
        zigzag - - true for zigzag wiring

      • importPixelblazeMap

        public void importPixelblazeMap​(String fileName, int index, float scale)
        Read a Pixelblaze compatible 2d/3d JSON map into the current ExpanderVerse's map, starting at the specified index. Since all maps in ExpanderVerse are 3D, if you import a 2D map, the z coordinate will be automatically set to zero.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Name of file to read
        index - starting destination index for map
        scale - Coordinate multiplier for scaling output
